name: Peanut Butter Cake II
author: Suzanne Stull
summary: If you like peanut butter without chocolate, you will love this cake. If you don't have cream, you may substitute milk.
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Grease and flour two 9 inch round cake pans
Combine 1/2 cup peanut butter and 1/2 cup butter or margarine
Add eggs one at time, mixing well after each one
Add cake mix alternately with the water
Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 25 minutes or until cake tests done
Allow cakes to cool in pan for 10 minutes and then turn out onto a cooling rack to cool completely
Assemble and frost with Peanut Butter Frosting once cool
To Make Peanut Butter Frosting: Combine 1 cup peanut butter, and 1/2 cup butter or margarine cream together until light and fluffy
Mix in enough cream to make the frosting of a spreading consistency
